comments:
When I upgraded (renamed old directory installed to new with old environment 
data) from 2.0 to 2.0.2 M3, everything I set seems to work except Ctrl-N.  
Instead of going to the next line as is the default (and what the keybinding 
configuration showed) in emacs it opened the new dialog (default behavior for 
eclipse).  

The quick fix for me was to enter in a default binding for Ctrl-N, and then 
remove it and it seems to be working now.  I didn't do any customization to my 
key mappings before I upgraded.

I have not tried to reproduce as I found a quick fix.
*** Bug 27153 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

With build 200211270010, I cannot seem to get Joseph's quick fix to work for me 
as Ctrl+N still does not work properly...

Hey... As soon as this little glitch is fixed... I'm all 100% eclipse convert!
(read: Joseph's workaround does not work for me... :( )

BTW: as bad as that is... the emacs key binding DID win me over! I hesitated...
not wanting to leave my cosy emacs... but... :)

the thrown exception is now fixed, so the workaround should be fine. i will 
look at the ctrl-n specific problem.

Unfortunately, as of build N20021204, I still cannot seem to get Joseph's quick 
fix to work for me...

This bug is driving me crazy!  Sometimes my Eclipse will get into a state where 
I can't make Ctrl-N do anything but bring up the "New" dialog.  I have tried 
every combination of mappings, etc. that I can think of.  Nothing seems to fix 
the problem predictable.  Then after a couple of hours, the problem will often 
go away as unexpectedly as it occurs.  The workarounds described by others do 
not work predictably.

Hi Guys,
I found another workaround that does work. The problem seems to be related on
how the MenuActions are hooked up in the Eclipse menu. NewWizardAction for
example sets the default accelerator Ctrl+N in its constructor. Obviously an
instance of NewWizardAction remains in memory after switching the key binding
configuration to Emacs and thereby reserves the binding Ctrl+N.
But once you choose the menu item File/New/Other... with your mouse and close
the Wizard the default binding is gone and the custom binding for Ctrl+N works fine.

hi..sorry back from the holidays.. i just fixed this. basically, the new 
wizard action (among a number of other i have found) was still 
using .setAccelerator() which can steal keys from the key bindings service. 
setAccelerator(..) is deprecated, and i am trying to track down all uses in 
eclipse right now. i have switched this action to work with the new key 
binding service - you may notice a new action in the key bindings dialog 'open 
new wizard' -> this is now assigned to Ctrl+N for the Global scope and Default 
configuration in the correct manner.
